[S title page:] Canto | Del Sign Passerini
"Domine ad adjuvandum" on additional folios added on the begining of each partbook.
Inscription "Del Sign. Passerini." in the upper left corner of S f. 2r.
"Del Sign Passerini" possibly refers to "Domine ad adjuvandum" only.
A copy or an arrangement of Johann Peter Gabriel Sperling "Concentus vespertinus seu psalmi" published in Bautzen, 1700, with additional unidentified "Domine ad adjuvandum".

No parts nor other material under this shelfmark. There is only an anonymous note according to which the whole PL-R RAp-83 manuscript was joined with PL-SA 173/A V 3. It is not sure which part of PL-SA 173/A V 3 was originally under PL-R RAp-83 shelfmark (perhaps clno parts), but it is doubtful that any part of PL-SA 173/A V 3 stem from PL-R collection.
Material transferred to PL-SA 173/A V 3 (Jacek Szczurowski).
